channel.title: blinking underscore
channel.description:
**Blackscreen with blinking underscore, Whonix workstation on Virtualbox with Debian host**
Also have this problem, can't find solution, could someone help please?
Started this project last week. Whonix gateway operates just fine. Workstation worked fine just after install. After rebooting it stopped working (as title indicates).
-Vm: System: Base memory 4090 MB processors: 4 -Display 128 MB GC: VMSVGA -OS host: Debian 11 (bullseye) -CPU: SVM Mode enabled
**General VirtualBox Troubleshooting Steps** General trouble shoot Walked through all recommendations Latest stable virtbox Yes Latest stable debian host Yes Sudo apt update && upgrade host Yes Debian bullseye Yes sudo adduser $(whoami) vboxusers Yes No other virtualizer Yes Ram 4000 MB Hardware (Desktop from 2020, enough resources) Other vms do work Debian guest works, ubuntu guest works
**VirtualBox Generic Bug Reproduction** recommended Linux distribution Debian 11 recommended version of the VirtualBox Latest Install VirtualBox Guest Additions I tried with and without guest additions
Note: - I have not booted with the nomodeset kernel parameter. (because I do not know how to do this in Whonix). - I am wondering if the issue here could be related to the nvidia gpu (as that is mentioned a youtube video with similar issues that I have) - I am not sure how to share logs, as I want to remain private. I pasted some repetitive lines from the log. - I can login into the virtual console but do not know what the use of this would be
LOG:
w=1024 h=768 bpp=0 cbLine=0x0 flags=0x2 origin=0,0 00:00:38.723550 Display::i_handleDisplayResize: uScreenId=0 pvVRAM=00007efe3c000000 w=1024 h=768 bpp=32 cbLine=0x1000 flags=0x1 origin=0,0 00:00:38.727988 GUI: UIMachineLogic: Guest-screen count changed 00:00:39.037493 Display::i_handleDisplayResize: uScreenId=0 pvVRAM=0000000000000000 w=1024 h=768 bpp=0 cbLine=0x0 flags=0x2 origin=0,0 00:00:39.039355 Display::i_handleDisplayResize: uScreenId=0 pvVRAM=00007efe3c000000 w=1024 h=768 bpp=32 cbLine=0x1000 flags=0x1 origin=0,0 00:00:39.039826 GUI: UIMachineLogic: Guest-screen count changed 00:00:39.329031 Display::i_handleDisplayResize: uScreenId=0 pvVRAM=0000000000000000 w=1024 h=768 bpp=0 cbLine=0x0 flags=0x2 origin=0,0

item.title: blinking underscore
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Not immediately helpful to point out but a blinking underscore isn’t the same as a black screen. A black screen is an issue with drawing at all. A graphic card driver / kernel / virtualizer issue.

A blinking underscore is evidence of a functional graphical output.

That might help should you decide to research this issue further.

An easy fix - data loss inside VM - if appropriate (not caring about data loss inside VM):

Kicksecure – 21 Dec 21

Kicksecure ™ Factory Reset

Resetting Kicksecure ™ to Vendor Defaults. Reset configuration files to defaults, re-install meta package, move the system closer to vendor defaults.

(Whonix is based on Kicksecure.)

The real debugging and fix could be quite harder…

interconnectfree2:

I have not booted with the nomodeset kernel parameter. (because I do not know how to do this in Whonix).

Documentation link functional, fixed just now: grub bootloader Configuration Changes

interconnectfree2:

I am wondering if the issue here could be related to the nvidia gpu (as that is mentioned a youtube video with similar issues that I have)

Likely not.

interconnectfree2:

I can login into the virtual console but do not know what the use of this would be

Shows further that it might not be a graphic card issue.

To investigate further:

Whonix – 3 Mar 22

Troubleshooting

Troubleshooting Installation and Network Issues with Whonix ™

  • General Troubleshooting
  • System Logs

Related:

Kicksecure – 23 Dec 21

Recovery

Recovery Mode, Emergency, Chroot, Debugging, Capturing Diagnostic Output from Serial Console

Read full topic

item.title: blinking underscore
item.dc:creator: interconnectfree2
item.description:
Blackscreen with blinking underscore, Whonix workstation on Virtualbox with Debian host

Also have this problem, can’t find solution, could someone help please?

Started this project last week. Whonix gateway operates just fine. Workstation worked fine just after install. After rebooting it stopped working (as title indicates).

-Vm:
System:
Base memory 4090 MB
processors: 4
-Display
128 MB
GC: VMSVGA
-OS host: Debian 11 (bullseye)
-CPU: SVM Mode enabled

General VirtualBox Troubleshooting Steps
General trouble shoot Walked through all recommendations
Latest stable virtbox Yes
Latest stable debian host Yes
Sudo apt update && upgrade host Yes
Debian bullseye Yes
sudo adduser $(whoami) vboxusers Yes
No other virtualizer Yes
Ram 4000 MB
Hardware (Desktop from 2020, enough resources)
Other vms do work Debian guest works, ubuntu guest works

VirtualBox Generic Bug Reproduction
recommended Linux distribution Debian 11
recommended version of the VirtualBox Latest
Install VirtualBox Guest Additions I tried with and without guest additions

Note:

  • I have not booted with the nomodeset kernel parameter. (because I do not know how to do this in Whonix).
  • I am wondering if the issue here could be related to the nvidia gpu (as that is mentioned a youtube video with similar issues that I have)
  • I am not sure how to share logs, as I want to remain private. I pasted some repetitive lines from the log.
  • I can login into the virtual console but do not know what the use of this would be

LOG:

w=1024 h=768 bpp=0 cbLine=0x0 flags=0x2 origin=0,0
00:00:38.723550 Display::i_handleDisplayResize: uScreenId=0 pvVRAM=00007efe3c000000 w=1024 h=768 bpp=32 cbLine=0x1000 flags=0x1 origin=0,0
00:00:38.727988 GUI: UIMachineLogic: Guest-screen count changed
00:00:39.037493 Display::i_handleDisplayResize: uScreenId=0 pvVRAM=0000000000000000 w=1024 h=768 bpp=0 cbLine=0x0 flags=0x2 origin=0,0
00:00:39.039355 Display::i_handleDisplayResize: uScreenId=0 pvVRAM=00007efe3c000000 w=1024 h=768 bpp=32 cbLine=0x1000 flags=0x1 origin=0,0
00:00:39.039826 GUI: UIMachineLogic: Guest-screen count changed
00:00:39.329031 Display::i_handleDisplayResize: uScreenId=0 pvVRAM=0000000000000000 w=1024 h=768 bpp=0 cbLine=0x0 flags=0x2 origin=0,0
